an7.54:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
an7.54:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an7.54:4.4: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points?”
an7.54:5.1: “Mendicant, it’s due to the cessation of views that an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:5.2: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:5.3: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:5.4: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:5.5: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.
an7.54:5.6: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand views, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:5.7: And so their views grow. They’re not freed from birth, old age, and death, from sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:6.1: An educated noble disciple does understand views, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:6.2: And so their views cease. They’re freed from birth, old age, and death, from sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:6.3: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’,
an7.54:6.4: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’,
an7.54:6.5: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’,
an7.54:6.6: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
an7.54:6.7: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.
an7.54:6.8: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or become nervous regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:7.1: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is just about craving. …
an7.54:7.6: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:7.7: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:7.8: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:7.9: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.
an7.54:7.10: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:7.11: And so their regrets grow. They’re not freed from birth, old age, and death, from sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:8.1: An educated noble disciple does understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
an7.54:8.2: And so their regrets cease. They’re freed from birth, old age, and death, from sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.
an7.54:8.4: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’ …
an7.54:8.5: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’
an7.54:8.6: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.
an7.54:8.7: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or become nervous regarding the undeclared points.
an7.54:8.8: This is the cause, this is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.”
